segments.text: Do you take a bus to and from work ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , everyday . And there ’ s only one choice . All the other buses are going the other direction .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Hmm . I have the same problem . When I leave work , it ’ s always rush hour . So the buses are always crowded .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , yeah , it ’ s terrible . I will tell you the funniest thing I have seen in China . It ’ s when so many people try to get onto one city bus , and the last guy is squeezed in so tight that the door is tightly pressed against his butt .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That sounds terrible the way you describe it . But you know , not long ago I really suffered on the bus .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What happened ? Were you having a hard time getting on a bus ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You just can ’ t imagine ! I waited for the first bus but it was too full , so I waited for the second , and it was still very crowded . Then I decided not to wait for the next one , and got on the second bus . It was so full that I had to stand on one foot ! No kidding !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: And it ’ s so much fun . One day , the bodies were so tightly packed that some girl ’ s behind was pressed against my front . I was afraid to put my hands down for fear of accidentally groping her .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You were so happy , weren ’ t you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What do you think ? I ’ m a good boy .
segments.speaker: S2
